alert.note: Alert for Preston; Tucker (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 22 at 10:13PM EDT until June 23 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EDT THURSDAY FOR SOUTHERN PRESTON AND NORTHWESTERN TUCKER COUNTIES... At 1013 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kingwood, Parsons, Rowlesburg, Newburg, Reedsville, Masontown, Albright, Tunnelton, Hannahsville, Israel, Fellowsville, Pifer Moutain, Aurora, Saint George, Lead Mine, Gladesville and Davisville. Weather service radar indicates the heaviest rain has moved out of the area, however runoff from the earlier heavy rain that occurred could still cause flash flooding. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
